page.title: 10ST AUSTIN & ST JOSEPH SCHOOL
page.content: There are four schools in our block, catering for a wide age range;a First (5-9years),a Comprehensive (11-18),a Convent School(fee-paying for boys up to 11 years, girls 11-18) and a school for special educational needs.The first three schools all have a Roman Catholic tradition. St.Austin First School, Kenilworth, has about 70 pupils organised in three classes. The buildings date from the 1890's following bequests from the sisters Amherst. The school catered for infants,juniors and seniors until 1959; it became a first schoolin 1976. St. Joseph's Convent School was founded in Coventry in 1862 by the Sisters of Mercy.During World War 2 St.Joseph's was evacuated to Stoneleigh Abbey. The school moved to Crackley Hall in 1945.
